intro: Ruehssia undulata, commonly known as the wavy ruehssia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that have a wavy or undulating edge. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, three-lobed berries. Ruehssia undulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
